intro: Balsamus theophrasti, commonly known as wild balsam, is a flowering plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the family Momordicaceae and is characterized by its hairy stems and heart-shaped leaves. The plant produces small, yellowish-green flowers that are followed by distinctive, spiny fruits. It is often found in disturbed soils and along roadsides, thriving in moist, temperate climates. Its botanical features make it a common weed in agricultural fields and gardens.
